title: Integrated Instructional Design for Online Certification in [Large-Scale] Engineering Education

context.prior_knowledge: Engineering foundational knowledge and basic programming competencies
context.additional_context: Implementation of Project-Based Assessment Using Online Certification Courses in a Smartphone-Centric Limited Technology Environment

learning_goals: Learners demonstrate technical practical competencies by completing at least one MOOC certification course in cloud computing, blockchain, or data analytics

Applying engineering knowledge (e.g., thermodynamics, fluid dynamics) acquired during an online certification process, learners select one real-world industrial problem (e.g., heat exchanger design, fluid flow optimization), submit a 5-page project report with simulation/experimental data within four weeks, and score at least 12 out of 15 points on an evaluation rubric assessing problem definition clarity, solution appropriateness, and depth of analysis.
Learners can analyze learning effectiveness of online certification courses through peer assessment and self-reflection

resources: Campus Learning Management System (LMS) Basic Features
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
